Package callOfDuty

Class Base

java.lang.Object
callOfDuty.Base
public class Base extends Object
This class represents the base that the game will be played on. All the targets and shooting will be placed on base
Author:
Jingyi Li

  • Field Details

    • targets

      private Target[][] targets
      Keeps a reference to the location of every Target in the game. Every location in this array points to a Target, specifically, an instance of a subclass of Target.

    • shotsCount

      private int shotsCount
      The total number of shots fired by the user.

    • destroyedTargetCount

      private int destroyedTargetCount
      The number of targets destroyed.

  • Constructor Details

    • Base

      public Base()
      Creates an 10x10 ”empty” Base (and fills the Targets array with Ground objects). Also initializes any game variables, such as how many shots have been fired.

  • Method Details

    • fillWithGround

      public void fillWithGround(Target[][] targets)
      Fill the given 2d Array of Targets with a Ground Objects
      Parameters:
      targets - : the given empty 2d Array

    • placeAllTargetRandomly

      public void placeAllTargetRandomly()
      Create and place all Targets randomly on the Base Place larger Target before smaller ones, and place buildings before tanks and oil drums. There may be no legal place to put a Target in the end

    • okToPlaceTargetAt

      public boolean okToPlaceTargetAt(Target target, int row, int column, boolean horizontal)
      Based on the given row, column, and orientation to decide whether it is legal to place the target
      Parameters:
      target - to place
      row - : row number of the position
      column - : column number of the position
      horizontal - , if the target is placed horizontal or vertical
      Returns:
      true if it is okay to put the Target with its head at this location; false otherwise. The buildings must not overlap another Target, or touch another building (vertically, horizontally, or diagonally) targets must not ”stick out” beyond the base. Does not actually change either the Target or the Base

    • placeTargetAt

      public void placeTargetAt(Target target, int row, int column, boolean horizontal)
      Sets the value of the “hit” array, “coordinate” array, and “horizontal” boolean value of the target. “Put” the Target in the Base. This involves giving values to the coordinate and horizontal instance variables in the Target, and it also involves putting a reference to the Target in each of 1 or more locations in the targets array in the Base object.
      Parameters:
      target - : the given target to place in the base
      row - : row number of the header of the target
      column - : column number of the header of the target
      horizontal - : if the target is placed horizontally or vertically

    • isOccupied

      public boolean isOccupied(int row, int column)
      Check if a given location contains a Target (not a Ground)
      Parameters:
      row - : row number of the given location
      column - : column number of the given location
      Returns:
      Returns true if the given location contains a Target(not a Ground), false if it does not.

    • getTargetsArray

      public Target[][] getTargetsArray()
      Get the 2d array containing all references of locations
      Returns:
      the targets array

    • ifCanPlaceTarget

      public boolean ifCanPlaceTarget(Target target)
      Check if a target can be possibly placed legally in the base grid
      Parameters:
      target - : the given target
      Returns:
      true if can be placed legally, false otherwise

    • shootAt

      public void shootAt(int row, int column)
      Attack the position specified by the row and the column.
      Parameters:
      row - : row number of the position being attacked
      column - : column number of the position being attacked

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver(Weapon weapon1, Weapon weapon2)
      Check if all targets have been destroyed or have run out of ammunition: game over
      Parameters:
      weapon1 - weapon 1 to check left shots
      weapon2 - weapon 2 to check ldft shots
      Returns:
      true if game is over, false otherwise

    • win

      public Boolean win()
      Check if all targets on base have been destroyed
      Returns:
      true if all targets have been destroyed

    • print

      public void print()
      Print the base. The top left corner square should be 0,0. “O” (capital letter O): Used to indicate a location that player has fired upon and hit a target. “-”: Use ‘-’ to indicate a location that player has fired upon and found nothing there. “X” (capital letter X): Use ‘X’ to indicate a location containing a destroyed Target. ‘.’: Use ‘.’ (a period) to indicate a location that you have never fired upon. “T”: Used to indicate an un-destroyed but hit Tank.

    • getShotsCount

      public int getShotsCount()
      Returns the number of shots fired
      Returns:
      the number of shots fired

    • incrementShotsCount

      public void incrementShotsCount()
      Increment the shotCount by 1 This method will be called from shootAt(int row, int column) from Weapon class.

    • getDestroyedTargetCount

      public int getDestroyedTargetCount()
      Returns the count of destroyed targets
      Returns:
      the number of destroyed targets

    • incrementDestroyedTargetCount

      public void incrementDestroyedTargetCount()
      Increment the destroyedTargetCount by 1

    • setDestroyedTargetCount

      public void setDestroyedTargetCount(int DestroyedTargetCount)
      Set the destroyedTargetCount by given integer
      Parameters:
      DestroyedTargetCount - : the integer to be set as destroyedTargetCount

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
